entities.description: An instrument to collect data on various topics related to substance use and mental health.
Indication that the respondent needed treatment for substance use but did not receive it.
Fear of losing job, home, or child custody due to substance use treatment.
Not ready to initiate substance use treatment due to various reasons.
Not ready to stop or reduce substance use despite recognizing a problem.
Belief that one could handle substance use issues without treatment.
Fear of disapproval from family, friends, or religious communities about seeking treatment.
Fear of being forced against one's will to receive treatment.
Belief that treatment for substance use would not be helpful.
Belief that no one would care if the respondent got better.

relationships.description: Indicates that the respondent needed substance use treatment but did not receive it.
Relates unmet treatment need to the fear of losing job, home, or child custody.
Indicates that the respondent was not ready to start substance use treatment.
Indicates that the respondent was not ready to stop using substances.
Relates unmet treatment need to the belief that treatment was unnecessary because the respondent could handle it on their own.
Indicates that the respondent feared disapproval from family, friends, or religious communities for seeking treatment.
Relates unmet treatment need to the fear of being forced to seek treatment against one's will.
Indicates that the respondent believed that treatment would not help their situation.
Indicates that the respondent believed that no one would care if they got better.
